comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: This is likely to be William Thomas Orton, b. 1898, shown in the 1911 Census as born at Tillingham, Kent, (which is either Gillingham, Kent or Tillingham, Essex?).  His Regimental number was 5457 and he is photographed wearing a 1914 pattern cap, both of which suggest that he enlisted in The Queen Victoria's Rifles 'under age' in the summer of 1915 (August or September) - aged 16 or 17.  This also means that he was on active service overseas well before the regulation age of 19, (in 1916, when reported missing, he would have been 18 at most).//

comment.author: 30886974@N00
comment._content: Such a young looking lad.  For God and Country and King.
